column4: Hey, I did a xorg reconfigure and selected my card as ATI, and my screen res, but the res is distorted (fills screen tho) and when i run GNOME it looks like this: http://i208.photobucket.com/albums/bb258/funnyav/Mesed.jpg
It really looks like that, completely messed up lol
BTW i have a laptop, ATI MOBILITY RADEON 9200
Could that be messing up the perspective and GNOME being exploded over the screen?
dunno, I don't have a wide screen
One more question, when XORG fails to start (happens a lot here lol) now i don't get a terminal, i need to press CTRL+ALT+F1 for a terminal, and i can't "start" X from there
if you need to Ctrl+Alt+F1 into a console, my guess is that an X server is running, but no display manager
Ok, cause typing GDM doesnt do anything
You said i needed to use the advanced option, how do i do that?
it comes up in the process.. when it comes to configuring your screen you can choose 'Easy' (or something; don't remember exactly), 'Medium' and 'Advanced'
Um... actually using the dpkg-reconfigure xserver.... blabla... it just asks me for the video card and res
I guess that narrows down what you are shown.. try leaving the switchs out
in full mode, you are being asked a lot of questions not only about the screen, but also about keyboard, mouse etc.
